summary: The Stop the Wait Act of 2025 aims to amend the Social Security Act to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits, allowing quicker access to these funds for individuals with disabilities. It also proposes temporary, phased-down waiting periods leading up to the complete elimination. Furthermore, it addresses Medicare eligibility, providing coverage to certain individuals who meet specific criteria during the waiting period. The bill includes conforming amendments to related sections of the Social Security Act and the Railroad Retirement Act.
